7C74DC5E13BC4CAF8F2C910FAA43065C.description: Write routinely in a genre over extended time frames (planning, drafting, editing, revising, publishing) for a range of discipline-specific tasks, purposes and audiences.

69962AD9CE6E48E4AB92D86E51692A23.description: Write routinely over shorter time frames (e.g., journal entry, letter, graphic organizer) for a range of discipline-specific tasks, purposes and audiences.

EB1F6ED93C6C4BDDA13D5AF0B4B06D3B.description: Sort evidence collected from print and/or digital sources into provided categories.

B250E7AE4809480FBB6868EB1D3825F0.description: Take brief notes (e.g., graphic organizers, notes, labeling, listing) on sources.

3EC34A7DD3DA4BA0945959ADDC046DFD.description: Identify key details in an informational text.

3239D05E239342E894C84A486374DD4E.description: Locate important points on a single topic from two informational texts or sources.

96CFCF1159D74C70BB4D10693D3E18F0.description: Use text features and search tools (e.g., key words, sidebars, hyperlinks) to locate information relevant to a given topic with the purpose of creating a permanent product (e.g., select/generate responses to form paragraph/essay).

001722D24E654ECE912D62E0BB6EE252.description: Gather information (e.g., highlight, quote or paraphrase from source) from informational text read aloud or information presented in diverse media and formats, including visually, quantitatively and orally.

F44E3F14ABE2401CA6CFFC6ED11A79C6.description: Recall information from experiences for use in writing.

05A1DCC748274AB19FA06B31BB4B3008.description: Recall relevant information from experiences for use in writing.

D5F06548F920498D8ED4B985D831373F.description: Follow steps to complete a short research project (e.g., determine topic, locate information on a topic, organize information related to the topic, draft a permanent product).

7D334C82BC644B9999F320750D690EFD.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

4B703B53B7AB4AE5911405129FB139CC.description: With guidance and support from adults, use technology to produce and publish writing (e.g., use Internet to gather information, word processing to generate and collaborate on writing).

394CDA19235B480097E30F659E2559E6.description: With guidance and support from peers and adults, edit writing for clarity and meaning.

2D0195BF614A4AA3B9F0020A8E7FA7A4.description: With guidance and support from peers and adults, strengthen writing by revising (e.g., review product, strengthening story).

BECDD16052484C889925AE775812596F.description: With guidance and support from adults, draft an outline in which the development and organization are appropriate to the task and purpose (e.g., determine the topic, gather information, develop the topic, provide a meaningful conclusion).

8F2D17109118482E843A676BB7CE14CA.description: With guidance and support from peers and adults, strengthen writing by revising.

04D292BE7F14465D9DD514338D4F564A.description: With guidance and support from adults, draft an outline in which the development and organization are appropriate to the task and purpose (e.g., define purpose, state your opinion, gather evidence, create your argument, provide a meaningful conclusion).

3083D9CB76A84D5F8EE414B46B807177.description: With guidance and support from adults, draft an outline in which the development and organization are appropriate to the task and purpose (e.g., to introduce real or imagined experiences or events, elaborate on experiences or events with details and techniques, provide a meaningful conclusion).

408981D5E2CD4C959BBD108FCD6FECE7.description: With guidance and support from peers and adults, develop a plan for writing (e.g., determine the topic, gather information, develop the topic, provide a meaningful conclusion).

941C0A5B3D604E2A8D828D4BE6FD2657.description: With guidance and support from peers and adults, develop a plan for writing based on a literary topic (e.g., select a topic, draft outline, develop narrative).

863AE6BFDF0C4D5F8ECD31B57F1D3F1F.description: With guidance and support from adults, produce a permanent product in which the development and organization are appropriate to the task and purpose.

7B64F82BE4AD46C2A0FF942090A38491.description: Provide a conclusion (concluding sentence, paragraph or extended ending) that follows from the narrated experiences or events.

D7245D02078B48A79B6338C5465BB599.description: Use temporal words and phrases to signal event order.

34ADEC5FD5B648C7ACD67A05E7051D16.description: When appropriate, use dialogue and descriptions of actions, thoughts and feelings to develop a story.

726BA79700794D6CB0669E3ED2137522.description: Sequence events in writing that unfold naturally.

75C511D0D1A44A2BA87E492EFFCA69AD.description: Develop the topic (e.g., offer additional information that supports the topic) by using relevant facts, definitions and details.

DE6CAD31E6F44A50BE6A9E6A68399F89.description: Introduce a topic and group related information together.

45C97834502C4636ACA938FC1CDCE050.description: Provide a concluding statement or section.

67D4BE3383254059B0E758CB95DD4CB0.description: Provide reasons or facts that support a stated opinion.

F8A1DAF050764E9E87CD15B19855FE9C.description: Produce (e.g., through dictation, writing, word array, picture) complete sentences when appropriate to task and situation.

2788DAAC5301441184971027292C3DBE.description: Add audio recordings and visual displays when appropriate to emphasize or enhance certain facts or details.

9EFFD2C0CB76457E8816EB83F20FF2BB.description: Elaborate on each fact or opinion given in support of a claim with relevant details.

D68AC57013514C86A8515B84E8183C34.description: Report on a topic or claim with a logical sequence of ideas, appropriate facts and relevant, descriptive details.

8A7FD7597D54447F8AE97ED67A138877.description: Ask and answer questions about information from a speaker, offering appropriate elaboration and detail.

BC887C944D6E46E699E36889594A6AE3.description: Identify supporting details of an informational text read, read aloud or information presented in diverse media and formats, including visually, quantitatively and orally.

98C8B1269FD142DBBB58D6D5FFD6D453.description: Determine the main idea of text read, read aloud or information presented in diverse media and formats, including visually, quantitatively and orally.

65BD2B2E187D4D5BABB56E6C1D8A52E0.description: Determine the central message, lesson or moral of a text read aloud or presented in diverse media and formats, including visually, quantitatively and orally.

4016770E0AC74C7DA06ECE8F9CC54AA7.description: Use context to confirm or self-correct word recognition.

BB9181AFD516426FB69707EC4EAEFABD.description: Read text (including prose and poetry) with accuracy, appropriate rate and expression (when applicable) on successive readings.

A4F0FE3850AF4228AB2B301BE3BFFD3C.description: Practice self-monitoring strategies to aid comprehension (e.g., reread, use visuals or cueing system, self-correct, ask questions, confirm predictions).

86B0E73E0AFD4AA398F666986B0955AA.description: Identify the meaning of most common prefixes.

6B64655C82E84D6A955AC0F0112E5673.description: Compare the similarities of two or more texts or adapted texts on the same topic or by the same author.

A165348849A843EE8A99AE8C66C1C5EF.description: Explain how the text's illustrations contribute to meaning.

B206352C1C3447BFB5EB0B12A94A4E26.description: Use descriptive words and illustrations/visuals from a story read or viewed to explain the mood in a given part of the story.

3CD0CAF3237A4D358B24426ACD3F4F93.description: Support inferences, opinions and conclusions using evidence from the text illustrations.

957C39E3849343D4A052255A0A351FDA.description: Distinguish their own point of view from that of the narrator or those of the characters.

5A8D0DD5CC21480B8177DA92CF2844C7.description: Identify narrator's or characters point of view.

962D9A2B37BB4EDCB3D3B46930C287DB.description: Describe how each part (chapter, scene or stanza) of a story, play or poem builds on earlier parts.

123115724020418C97E69A0B5A12402C.description: Identify how the structure of a play is different than the structure of a story (e.g., text includes props; dialogue without quotation marks acts/scenes instead of chapter).

3EA0F769733847A48F10089D9D869465.description: Identify how the structure of a poem is different than a story (e.g., rhymes are shorter than stories; stanza instead of paragraph).

6462A13850284FCAB0D73CDAE9DDE139.description: Identify parts and structure of stories.

A76892D8613640D7BABCCC4F3C1F2007.description: Determine the meaning of literal and non-literal words and phrases as they are used in a text.

EC7876362FB343A797BB5CA4CB367B85.description: Analyze how a characters point of view influences a conflict within a text.

E5FB768A1C4F4F0B8840ED8709BEF60C.description: Describe how a character changed in a story (e.g., different words, thoughts, feelings, actions).

E497253E8D0942DDA86E2D6F849ECE45.description: Explain a characters feelings in a story using the characters thoughts, words and actions as evidence from the text.

F1C976BDA28E41438C234F6DF0338603.description: Describe a characters traits in a story using details from the text and illustrations.

434A0DCA7CE249F597550445B0BABAE0.description: Use information in the text to determine and explain a lesson learned by a character or theme within the story.

19AA2DAFA27E4DF0B64F3969AB04AA01.description: Identify the central message (theme), lesson or moral within a story, folktale or fable from diverse cultures.

5251337463D0414EAEA6EDA8C1811911.description: Ask questions about the text (relationship between characters, events, conflicts) to demonstrate understanding.

7727B61706624600BD92ABAE414E1E6C.description: Support inferences, opinions and conclusions using evidence from the text, including illustrations.

DCF44F4D3C614FE0BB4934198F567C13.description: Answer questions (literal and inferential) and refer to text to support your answer.

C575DDC0E01745C28B6A06AA81BEBDCB.description: Answer questions related to characters, setting, events or conflicts.

3EB59430E0FE4E3B8BA17E36CA3752ED.description: Identify signal words that help determine the text structure in an informational text.

E3FAF6B481114B339219F3FD449CE1CC.description: Identify the cause and effect relationships in an informational text.
